As soon as we had arrived at that island which Ι have just now said was called Juana, Ι proceeded along its coast towards the west for some distance 3 I found it so large and without perceptible end, that Ι believed it to be not an island, but the continental country of Cathay36 seeing, however, no towns or cities situated on the sea-coast, but only some villages and rude farms, with whose inhabitants I was unable to converse, because as soon as they saw us they took flight. Ι proceeded farther, thinking that Ι would dis- cover some city or large residences.
